label: 三業
対訳語: The Three Actions of sentient beings
本: Sand and Pebbles: The Tales of Mujû Ichien, A Voice for Pluralism in Kamakura Buddhism . State University of New York Press . 1985
説明文: tri-karma; cf., gō. These are (1) deeds of the body (shingō, kāya-karma); (2) of words, sound, voice (kugō, vāk-karma); and (3) of thought (igō, manah-karma). These parallel the Three Mysteries, or Teaching-practices" (sammitsu, triguhya) of Mahāvairocana (Dainichi Nyorai), and when the identity of the two is realized experientially, the practitioner "attains Buddhahood in his very body" (sokushin jobutsu). See mikkyō; also Kiyota 1978. [業、身業、口業、意業、三密、大日如来、即身成仏、密教]"
